What is the difference between a migraine and a regular headache?

Migraine is a type of headache, but it is specifically defined as a throbbing, pulsing, or painful headache that is usually located in one side of the head, and can spread to involve the entire head, or any part of the face, or a particular region of the neck.

Assistant: Nausea and sensitivity to light are also symptoms of migraines.  However, it's more common for these symptoms to last for less than a day in migraine sufferers.  Also, they are often only associated with the actual migraine and not the pre-migraine or post-migraine symptoms.  Migraines can affect the whole body including nausea, vomiting, pain in any area, and sensitivity to light.

Assistant: Sensitivity to light (photophobia) and nausea (nausea, or “upset stomach”) are more common symptoms of the flu or some other type of viral infection, but they are not generally associated with migraines.
Are time outs helpful for kids?

I would say so.  Most people can learn by having a consequence for when they make a mistake, and time outs is an easy and effective consequence.  But they’re often used too harshly, and so can be ineffective or even counter-productive.
What do you mean too harshly?

To be clear, time outs are an effective consequence for misbehavior, but the child may see them as “time-out jail”, which is something to be avoided, rather than a necessary consequence.  So for me to be effective in helping you set up a good consequence for misbehavior, I would need to learn more about your family and what you’re trying to accomplish.
ok so they might be ok once in a while?

Assistant: Yes, I think they can be helpful when the child misbehaves, but they should be used with a little bit of compassion and understanding that it’s not the natural state of things to have an adult yelling at them.  Time outs are also often used without letting the child know how they’re getting out of the time out, which can make it feel arbitrary or like a punishment, rather than a consequence for something they did.  It’s really easy for adults to do this kind of thing unconsciously.  It’s easy to get caught up in the notion that “They’re in time out, and that’s the end of it!” but kids can be pretty imaginative, and they can use their own creativity to make their way out of time outs.  A compassionate time out ends when the child shows a sign of understanding what they’ve done wrong, and are ready to begin again.  That way the child knows they’re learning, and that the parent is seeing them as an intelligent person, even if they sometimes mess up.  You can still use the other techniques you were using to be tough when necessary, but using a compassionate approach will let you use them without actually using them!
Assistant: If your child has been misbehaving a lot, and it’s because they don’t understand or care about the rules, then a time out could be a good consequence to try.

Why are so many stores closed on Sundays? Is it a religious reason?

Assistant: No.  The USA was founded by a Puritan group of Protestants, but it didn’t adopt the religion of the Puritans until much later, and it was always a secular state.  The Puritans observed the Sabbath on Sunday, and the Puritans only had a small influence in the early history of the USA.  It’s difficult to trace the origins of closing stores on Sunday, but one early and short-lived attempt at forcing the Sabbath on people in the 1800s was motivated by the Protestant ideal that people should spend Sunday focusing on spiritual activities.  By the mid-1800s, when the Sunday closing law was made, there was not a lot of pressure from that standpoint, but the church had begun to advocate for Sunday closing laws as a way of counteracting the negative effects of industrialization on the day of rest.  Even after that shift, closing stores on Sunday was not always possible, since the religious Sunday was not always chosen for observance.  And as industrialization accelerated and mechanization made it possible to operate stores on Sunday, the law was not enforced as much as people liked.  The day of rest was also being violated by stores that stayed open all day on Sunday, so closing stores on Sundays became an effort to protect the Sabbath for all citizens.
Assistant: It’s not religious. There are two reasons for this: stores don’t earn enough revenue on Sundays to pay their staff, and the risk of theft is so high, so they keep the stores closed.

Can you give me some examples of a palatalization?

The term palatalization refers to a sound shift, and is typically used in a technical sense. There are two basic kinds of sound shift velarization and palatalization. Velarization refers to a shift from a sound in the back of the mouth to a sound in the front. Palatalization refers to a shift from a sound in the front of the mouth to a sound in the back of the mouth. These types of shifts are actually quite common, as a lot of languages change their sound systems over time. Take the English words for “old” and “cold”. In Old English (also called Anglo-Saxon, or sometimes “OE”), these were pronounced as [adl] and [kld]. In Middle English (or “ME”), they were pronounced with a “d” that’s like a “t” (like in the “t” in the word “toy”), and [k]. But in Modern English, we now pronounce the “d” more like “t”, and the [k] has palatalized to a [t]. Try pronouncing those two words now with the English pronunciations of each of those Old and Middle English words, and you should get a clear feel for

Also, this shift happens from the Middle to the Modern English, not Old to Middle or Modern. Here’s an example
/ sounds moved from a more front position to a more back position. This resulted in things like /ā/ becoming [æ], and /e/ becoming [e].

What is macular degeneration?

Well, macular degeneration is a common condition where the cells in the center of the retina (called the macula) lose their ability to receive light.  This loss of visual function, usually due to damage to the blood vessels that supply the retina, leads to blindness in the affected eye(s).  The condition is very common in people over the age of 60.  It’s not treatable and cannot be reversed.
Do you know what damages the blood vessels that supply the retina?

Yes, it’s caused by the build up of toxic deposits (called drusen) in the eye, similar to the build up of calcium deposits in your arteries that can lead to hardening of the arteries.  The leading causes of this build up of deposits are smoking, high cholesterol levels, high blood pressure, and diabetes.
Can an ophthalmologist see the drusen?
Yes, it’s possible for an ophthalmologist to see them with an ophthalmoscope, or a slit lamp.  They also can use a test called fluorescein angiography to look at the blood flow through the retina.
And can the drusen be removed?

Not at the current time.  Even the fluorescein angiography can’t reliably show where the drusen are located.  The way this disease usually progresses is that first the blood flow slows down in the center of the retina.  In the early stages of the disease, a very low dose of a drug called a vasodilator (like Diamox) can improve the blood flow, but later this can’t be done.  The macular degeneration progresses and eventually the retina becomes disconnected from the central area of the brain that controls vision.
Is testing being done to find a cure for macular degeneration?

Assistant: Yes, there’s a very large effort to find better methods of treating macular degeneration and to develop a cure, such as via gene therapy.  There’s also research to find the causes and improve treatments for the conditions that lead to the build up of drusen.  One major focus of this research is to understand how to prevent damage to the blood vessels that supply the retina in the first place.  This involves studying factors like oxidative stress, inflammation, and vascular damage.
Assistant: Yes, a trial is underway at the University of Utah to use gene therapy to prevent the build up of drusen deposits.

What was Yugoslavia and what happened to it?

The breakup of Yugoslavia was a process that occurred over the course of two years, starting in 1991.  Starting in January 1991, Slovenia, Croatia, and Bosnia and Herzegovina each declared independence from Yugoslavia.  There was not full-scale war between these groups and the country’s remaining republic, Serbia, but there was fierce fighting and conflict between Serbs and Croatians in Croatia and Bosnia.  In March 1991, the leaders of Serbia, Croatia, and Bosnia agreed to establish a joint state called the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.  After Serbia’s president Slobodan Milosevic threatened to create a Greater Serbia if Bosnia and Herzegovina would not agree to a centralized state, Croatia and Bosnia declared their independence in 1991.  A further agreement was made in 1992 that all the former republics would join a loose association of states known as the “Federal Republic of Yugoslavia”, and this was accepted in the U.N. as the successor state to Yugoslavia.  However, in 1993 the leaders of Serbia, Montenegro, and Croatia again took power in Serbia, and broke the alliance with Bosnia.  A war began between Serbia and Bosnia, which killed thousands and led to the refugee crisis that lasted into the 21

No, the breakup occurred when the people who became the presidents of the new states were just starting out as public figures.  Slovenia, Croatia, and Bosnia all held free elections as soon as possible, in 1992, to elect new leaders.  President Josip Broz Tito did not become head of Yugoslavia until the country became independent from the Soviet Union in 1945.  It wasn’t until 1980 that he declared the country to be a “socialist” state, but other groups in the country disliked that, and by the early 1990s many were calling for Yugoslavia to become a “federal republic” or to dissolve altogether.

How can I clarify butter?

Assistant: If you are making homemade butter, you should warm your milk and cream on the stove until just the first bubbles form around the edges, and stir continuously to keep the temperature around 100 degrees. Pour the liquid butter into a bowl and set it aside, ideally in a cool place.  After a while, the watery liquid will separate from the butter.  Skim the top layer off to get your clarifying butter, which can be poured into a clean jar.  You can now make the final butter that will be used for cooking or baking by slowly adding the watery liquid to the jar of clarified butter.  This will help incorporate the fat from the liquid into the clarified butter.

When you are driving, you would be able to see out the window and steer and accelerate and brake with a joystick or other controls, so it’s like you are driving, but you aren’t.  You’d control the robot, and the robot would control the car.  If you wanted to be super safe, you could build an extra sensor in the car that would only drive in the safest conditions, and when there were hazards, or if the car sensed the driver wasn’t doing what they should, then the robot would actually take over control of the car and drive it instead. Assistant: The safety of autonomous cars is a very controversial topic right now.  As a car moves along a road, it’s constantly receiving information from its sensors: can it see nearby traffic, or other road users?  And it’s constantly receiving information from its GPS system: what is the speed limit in this location, where are the red lights?  And it’s always making decisions: how fast should it go?  Does it have the right-of-way?  The driver is an important part of all of this decision-making, but it’s one of the most challenging areas of technology.  Autonomous cars are often compared to flying an airplane, where you just get on and have your fun, and there’s a crew in charge.  The computers do the hard work of flying.  But you can’t just look at something and tell if it’s safe to drive.  There’s always a tradeoff.  For example, we can take a picture of an intersection and see how many cars have stopped there at different times, and then estimate how many cars are likely to arrive in the future.  But no image will ever be able to tell you exactly how many cars will be in an intersection at any given time, because each car is in motion, and each driver is different and can change his or her mind in the moment.  In the end, the computer is probably making hundreds of judgments, some of them simple, and some of them incredibly complicated.  And humans make judgments too.  That’s why the driver needs to be paying attention, and must still be able to see clearly, and still must have his or her own ideas about what to do.

Why is the sky blue?

Blue is the color of light with the shortest wavelengths, between the violet end and the green end of the spectrum.  That part of the spectrum is more easily absorbed by water in the atmosphere. Rayleigh scattering is the process by which light interacts with gas atoms and molecules, and is responsible for creating the blue color of the sky.  Atoms and molecules interact with light because it has a property called “momentum” and the atoms have an amount of “kinetic energy” that will be transferred to the light and change the path of the light as it goes through the atmosphere.

What is Watergate scandal?

To understand the Watergate scandal, we should start with the election of Richard Nixon as president of the United States in 1968.  It was Nixon’s second time being elected to the presidency, having first won in 1960, after John F. Kennedy’s assassination.  But Nixon’s election also sparked protests from Americans protesting Vietnam War, civil rights, and the effects of the war on the economy.  In this political environment, Nixon began the administration known as the “Great Silence”, a period where he didn’t talk about the issues facing the nation and didn’t hold press conferences.  So while there was a strong opposition to his administration, there was no reliable record of what the Nixon administration actually believed and what actions it was taking.
Was Nixon personally involved in the scandal?

Many scandals surrounded the Nixon administration.  The “Watergate scandal” is one in particular that involved a number of burglars breaking into the Democratic National Committee offices in the Watergate office complex in Washington D.C. during the 1972 presidential election.  One of the burglars was arrested and revealed a number of links between himself and the White House, which involved a conspiracy to cover up evidence of the Watergate break-in.  As it turned out, the burglary was committed by Nixon’s reelection committee, and evidence found in Nixon’s own handwriting was discovered that related to the Watergate burglary.  Nixon’s involvement in the scandal was the issue that finally forced him to resign from the office of the president in 1974.
Was Nixon a good president otherwise?

Assistant: Nixon’s election was considered a political comeback for him, after his defeat in the 1960 election to John F. Kennedy.  He was well liked by many, for his administration which was praised for its intelligence and diplomatic progress, but also for his policy of détente with the Soviet Union.  Nixon’s term was also marked by major policy achievements, including the Apollo 11 lunar mission, desegregation of the schools, the 1973 oil embargo, the “Nixon Shock” in 1971, and a large increase in the number of college graduates.  So he certainly wasn’t bad for America.  But he did oversee some major political scandals, and that led to his resignation in 1974.

Assistant: Before the Watergate scandal, Nixon had not been doing a very good job of governing.  The “Great Silence” was an attempt to keep him out of the press, which resulted in a lack of information about what the Nixon administration was doing.  The strong opposition from various groups of people led Nixon to fail to successfully implement policies of his own.  The war in Vietnam escalated, and the cost of it increased and went up to a large budget deficit.  This contributed to the crash of the economy, and Nixon’s inflationary monetary policies and tax cuts contributed to large inflation rates.

The biggest pros are a high-energy-density and very long lifespan. The cons are a high initial cost, low cycle life, and some safety concerns. An LED bulb doesn’t emit light when it’s off, so you can’t tell if it’s working by looking at it.

Can you describe things about the respiratory system in humans

Sure.  The respiratory system in humans is generally broken down into four major parts the nasal cavity, the pharynx, the larynx, and the bronchi.  The nasal cavity is part of the external nose, and is divided into the left and right nasal cavities by the nasal septum.  The pharynx is just the throat, and is divided into the nasopharynx, the oropharynx, and the laryngopharynx.  The larynx is divided into the larynx, the epiglottis, and the trachea.  The larynx is a hollow organ that houses the vocal cords and the glottis.  The bronchi are air passages that branch from the trachea and conduct air to the lungs.
And where are the lungs located?

The lungs are contained in the thorax, which is a portion of the human body.  The lungs consist of the right lung, left lung, and two lobes, the right upper lobe and the left upper lobe.  The heart, a muscle located in the center of the chest, pumps blood throughout the body.  The blood then travels through a system of arteries and veins, carrying oxygen and nutrients to tissues and returning waste products to the lungs.  The left lung also has two lobes, the left upper lobe and the left lower lobe.  The right lung is separated into three lobes the right upper lobe, the right middle lobe, and the right lower lobe.  The lungs are located on the left and right sides of the chest.
And what in the thorax, or chest, protects the lungs?

Assistant: The rib cage is a bone structure located in the thorax, and is made up of twelve pairs of ribs.  The ribs are connected to the breastbone (sternum) and to the spine (thoracic vertebrae).  In between each pair of ribs are spaces for the lungs to move.  Ribs are separated by two thin membranes called the pleura.  In the center of each side of the rib cage is the heart, which is enclosed by the sternum, breastbone, and spine.  The diaphragm is a sheet of muscle that sits just above the lungs, and separates the thoracic cavity (the space between the lungs and the abdomen) from the abdominal cavity (the space between the abdomen and the chest).  The diaphragm is used to allow breathing, but it also helps regulate the pressure of the abdomen, and thus blood flow, to help the heart function more efficiently.

Assistant: The lung tissue itself does not have a lot of protection, but the pleural cavity is lined with a very thin membrane called the pleura, which keeps the lungs and heart protected from the rest of the body.  The rest of the thorax is separated into the central tendon, the sternum, the rib cage, the posterior ribs, the intercostal muscles, the internal thoracic artery, the internal thoracic vein, and the esophagus.  The intercostal muscles are intercostal muscles.  They help to maintain the integrity of the rib cage and provide rigidity to the chest wall.  The internal thoracic artery and the internal thoracic vein both transport blood from the right ventricle to the intercostal muscles.  The esophagus connects the pharynx to the stomach.

What does grief feel like?

Grief can be described as a complicated mix of emotions like sadness, loneliness, longing, fear, and a sense of loss.  I’m sorry to hear about your grief.  You may experience many different emotions about your loss, and you may not be able to easily predict what you’ll feel in the future.  Grief may last for weeks, months, or years, and it’s perfectly normal to feel it will last forever.  Grief can be similar to sadness, but it’s different in that it’s also related to feelings of anger or regret.
Can you elaborate on that?

Grief is the result of a loss and usually causes the person experiencing it to feel sad, angry, or depressed.  Losses can be big or small.  For example, you might be sad because a small animal that you had in your home died.  You might feel like you failed the animal when it died, or that you should have done more for it.  You might be angry at your dog for getting into a fight with a neighborhood cat, and so on.  Often grief can be seen as a mixture of many other emotions, but in the main it is often experienced as a more negative state of mind than sadness.  You might feel more hopeless or helpless than sad, or you might feel really angry at someone or something for causing your grief.  Those emotions and feelings are related to your loss, and will vary according to the loss you experienced.  Your grief will be different than someone else’s grief for the same reason.
Are there different types of grief?

There are many ways to think about the different types of grief.  Some types of grief are recognized by certain characteristics.  For example, what you feel when you lose a loved one that you have a close, long-term relationship with is called complicated grief.  It’s a complicated type of grief because it usually involves many feelings, and it can be difficult to predict the exact types of feelings you will have.  Another type of grief, called ordinary grief, is the most common type of grief, and typically involves someone who loses a close friend or family member.  This type of grief is experienced by many people, but it can also be less complicated than other types of grief, since it usually involves a sense of loss, and just the standard feelings of sadness, anger, and helplessness that are usually involved with loss.
How do you know when it's complicated versus ordinary grief?

First, if you feel very sad or depressed after a loss, that’s generally a sign that you’re feeling grief.  The important thing is to be careful not to let those feelings of depression and sadness prevent you from doing the things you need to do in order to feel better, such as reaching out to friends and family members, and following a healthy eating and sleeping routine.  Another sign that you’re experiencing grief is that you might feel angry at people or things that have nothing to do with your loss.  If you’re angry, or feel that you’re being mistreated, it’s a sign that you are experiencing grief.  Again, though, this feeling is common and doesn’t always mean that you are experiencing grief.  If you feel both sad and angry, but you also feel worried and depressed, that’s usually a sign that you are experiencing complicated grief.

Is it true we can live with only one kidney?

I think you’d live without both kidneys, but they’re really important.  To be precise, there are three primary functions of the kidneys.  The first is to maintain the salt levels in your blood, which is why we always have a lot of water with us.  The second is to maintain the right levels of blood glucose, which is why we usually have some candy on us when we travel.  And the third is to remove toxic materials from the bloodstream, and these are often large protein molecules.  A single kidney can do all of these things, but it can’t do it all at once.  I don’t know how long you could live with just one kidney, but I can find out for you.
Don't fairly young people donate kidneys and live out their entire lives almost as normal?

They generally do.  This is because the human body has quite a bit of redundancy.  It is a bad idea to operate on one person with two kidneys, but otherwise you can just live with a part of yourself missing.
How come we can live with one kidney but not for example one lung?

I think you can live with half a lung, but they have to be replaced, and it’s hard to survive for a long time without both lungs.  Maybe you could live with one lung for a month or two, but you’d start feeling sick.  It’s also really hard to keep a lung healthy outside the body.
So why can you live a month or two only with one lung but for decades with one kidney?

Assistant: Good question.  The kidney actually has a lot of redundancy built in, it has both blood supply and urine drainage, and it can also repair damaged tissue by itself.  The lungs don’t have the same kind of support.  In addition, when you remove one kidney the body builds extra veins and capillaries, which also helps to maintain the blood pressure.

Assistant: I think it is probably related to the fact that most of your blood is pumped through the lungs, and just small amounts of it pass through the kidneys.  It’s not very good to keep a lung outside the body, because it is designed to do a very specific job.  A kidney is also a very important organ, but it doesn’t need to be inside the body to perform its duties.

What are the benefits of zinc supplements?

Zinc is an important element that our bodies need to function properly.  A common mineral, it is essential for growth, immune system function, tissue repair, and wound healing.  A lack of zinc can result in problems with red blood cells, too few sperm, heart and bone health problems, poor memory, and poor concentration.  Many people also take zinc supplements for skin and hair health.
Is it safe to take supplements instead of getting zinc mainly from food?

It’s difficult to determine whether taking zinc supplements instead of getting it from food is harmful or safe, since many people have access to zinc through their diet and many others don’t.  If your diet is not likely to provide enough zinc, then taking supplements may be the only way to obtain enough of it.  It’s important to note that supplements are not regulated by the FDA, so they can be dangerous if made by unscrupulous manufacturers.
Are there any risks if you have too much zinc in your body?

Too much zinc can result in zinc toxicity, or overdose, which can cause vomiting, diarrhoea, skin rashes, and also weaken immune system function.  People who are at high risk of zinc overdose are infants, children, and people with certain health problems.  If you don’t know your zinc levels, you can test for them by having a blood test.  As a general rule, your doctor will probably recommend that you stay within the lower levels of the safe range for your health.
